TopicTitle: Show off your awesome KSP pictures!

Articles.Content:
Pandyssia Space Exploration launched its second Sovereign-class starship, and immediately had to deorbit due to a bug in the game. The three crew members returned with three evac pods. The other three were used to deorbit the spacecraft, but the coupling of the docking ports and the pods' parachutes were enough to bring it down safely.

PSE's aviation team came up with the idea of a light SSTO spaceplane that is capable of gliding in thin atmospheres. Thus, the XK-class stratoglider was constructed. It is powered by two SABRE engines, and capable of running them even in very thin air. Its closed-cycle functioning time is very limited, though.

(I totally did not leave the HUD turned on to brag about my first successful landing from orbit at KSC.)

My Aldo probe in orbit around Eeloo.

And its Hans lander standing on the surface.

Edited May 24, 2014 by Felsmak
Here's my latest and greatest endeavor: A twenty-Kerbal ship that retrieved a class-E asteroid and brought it back to LKO. Yes, that "little" ship has twenty Kerbals in it.

I am so mad. I have never seen an eclipse from the surface.

Orbit? Plenty of times.

I was finishing a manned orbital mission from Duna and I landed RIGHT on the beach.

Decided to do a little after-mission photo-shoot with the Kerbals and my friend Salamore0 says:

"You should get an eclipse"

I try to EXPLAIN to him that it just can't be done - the angle would be wrong.

I look over my shoulder: BOOM, eclipse.
More pictures of my Eeloo probe!

Jeb messing around outside my space station's new habitation module

Nice shot of the station as it now orbits.

Also not really KSP, but I am now the proud owner of a copy of the December 1969 issue of National Geographic Magazine!

Jeb messing around outside my space station's new habitation module

Edited May 26, 2014 by Mareczex333

Darn. I've always wanted to make stock cockpits, and my cobra replica even had a two seater stock cockpit. Maybe I should try to make some planes to accompany my space fleet. I already have an anti satellite F-15 ASM 135 I posted.

Made a small little solar powered rover on Duna. I actually landed it with a skycrane/parachute. Kinda reminds me of a dragonfly if you ask me.

Ok, Maybe I got a little bored.

I went to the desert for Jeb's holiday (for science, of course!):

Oh, and then there's Jeb fooling around, doing his best cactus impression:

If you look really closely, you can see that he's not a real cactus. Surprisingly, he's not the lopsided one in the background, blame the landing for that (unsurprisingly).

Edited May 26, 2014 by Shna_na

Nerdof getting rescued with a B9 VX-1 Vance

sadly, i crashed it. The Great 3 (Bill, Bob and Jeb) got hit by a piece of wing and were killed.

Sent away another probe duo, this time to Bop. The main probe is called Petyr.

The lander is called Lysa.

Sent away another probe duo, this time to Bop. The main probe is called Petyr.

The lander is called Lysa.

That is the smallest, cutest probe I've ever seen!

Plan-Ex Electron Dart probe on the way to Jool. This made me realise that I never ever want to sit through another ion engine burn to Jool again.

Also, the Libra is en route to Duna now:

Kerbin Spacedock II is essentially complete:

And finally, a new Munar station in the works, StarLab:

As usual thereÃ‚Â´s awesome at work in this thread, so i am coming back from my dark stalking corne in order to add to it, i took an idea from here and made copÃƒÂ©rnico station:

(lets see if i remember how to upload these)

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Lots of new stuff on the space station, now named "Juggler Station" for all the modules I've moved around and some complex maneuvers to do so.

Solar mast, pretty dang big and hard to maneuver.

Installed KAS for reasons. Here's Bill and Bob working on installing maintenance ladders and illumination so that night operations aren't as dark.

Here's some of the reasoning for the renaming: Solar Mast and Arrays went from top to side, connected to the Utility/Cargo Storage Module, and the ACICAM went from the back to the top.

Bill and Bob after performing some critical maintenance. The station was randomly hit with a terrible case of the wobbles, so they had to go out and use the KAS struts to stabilize everything. Much more stable, although the event did make me consider turning off the attitude control that keeps the station oriented the same way relative to the planet (cupola downwards). In the background you can see the two vertical masts that make up part of the station now: the Solar Mast on right and the Docking Array on left.

A darn cool shot from the cupola. Not much needs to be said. This one will be going up as the background to my Twitter page.

Fun Fact: Juggler Station is the only vessel, debris or controlled, in this save at the moment. Hooray for self-disposing launchers!

Joegee, what do you think you are doing?

I wanted to share a wierd anomaly i witnessed while on kerbin. and testing a wreck... ehem* a spaceplane prototype, while fooling around, note that the gravity hack was not used in the making of this.

It's a ladder thing: the guy was the wrong way up on them. He reached the top of the climb and appeared to be floating like so, this could be to do with the non-stock part that he was on. The collision box for it could be wonky.
